subject: Re: Help setting up JUnit
msgSnippet: ... wasn t ... problem is ... classpath & ... Google for ... the best ... No offense taken (sorry for the delay in responding – out of town); I am definitely
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Jason Rogers <jacaetevha@f...> wrote:
> On Wed, 28 Jan 2004 19:42:02 -0000, dinglek2004 <dinglek@h...>
> wrote:
>
> > Not explicitly, but I did not think that was necessary. There
wasn't
> > anything about it in the JUnit docs. The file is in the directory
> > junit\tests\runner under my base classpath directory, and the
> > reference within the call is to junit.tests.runner.LoadedFromJar,
> > which is correct from the base classpath. I tried adding it in
> > explicitly without success.
>
> Don't take this the wrong way, but it doesn't sound like your
problem is
> JUnit related. It sounds like you need to brush up on Java
classpath &
> Java commandline usage. You can look at
> http://www.kevinboone.com/classpath.html for more help, or just
Google for
> 'java classpath' and 'java commandline', you will get tons of hits.
>
> --
> Jason Rogers
>
> "So great is the ignorance, so very little the knowledge, of even
the best
> of men!" - John Wesley, "Christian Perfection"

No offense taken (sorry for the delay in responding  out of town);
I am definitely new to this. That said I do not understand the
failure on the JUnit self-test. The classpath appears to be correct,
even after reading the material you suggested. It has the base
directory listed as well as the junit.jar file. The system is
locating the other class files for the other tests, and is locating
the "test.jar" file. I inserted an additional assert in the code to
verify the load jar file command returned correctly. The
ClassNotFoundException exception is thrown when it tries to load the
class junit.tests.runner.LoadedFromJar using the loadClass() method
(line 33 in the file TestCaseClassLoaderTest.java). The test.jar
file has the correct path embedded in it (file LoadedFromJar.class
with path junit\tests\runner according to zip), so I am not sure
what the failure is. The other 118 tests all pass, and I have not
made any modifications other than those specified in the FAQ.
